Package lab10.cscd210methods

Class CSCD210Lab10Methods

  • java.lang.Object
    • lab10.cscd210methods.CSCD210Lab10Methods
  • public class CSCD210Lab10Methods
extends java.lang.Object
    The methods for the Andromeda Problem.
    All parameters will be passed as final
    All preconditions and post conditions will be enforced

      • fillGeneration

        public static int[][] fillGeneration​(java.util.Scanner fin)
        This method creates the generation array which is a 10 x 10 2D array of integers. The array is then filled with the values from the file.
        Parameters:
        fin - Representing a Scanner object to the open file
        Returns:
        int[] [] Representing the filled generation array
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if fin is null

      • print

        Parameters:
        array - Representing the filled generation array
        day - Representing which day the generation is on
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the array is null or the length less than 1
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if day is less than 1

        Throws:

      • runSolution

        public static int[][] runSolution​(int[][] array,
                                  int[] solution)
        This method is the hardest part of the assignment. It is passed the 1D solution array and the 2D generation array. The method makes a new temp 2D array that is 10 x 10. The idea here is each element in the generation array is examined. The solution is applied against the generation array and the results are stored in the new temp array for that element. Once all elements in the generation array have been processed the temp array is returned.
        Parameters:
        array - Representing the 2D generation array
        solution - Representing the 1D solution array
        Returns:
        int [][] Representing a new 2D generation array
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if either array is null or the length is less than 1

      • readNum

        public static int readNum​(java.util.Scanner fin)
        The readNum methods reads the number of solutions and the number of days from the file
        Parameters:
        fin - Representing a valid Scanner object
        Returns:
        int Representing the number read from the file
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if fin is null
        NOTE:
        there is no prompt only just reading from the file
